alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 8:00AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN CHEYENNE COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL COLORADO THROUGH 830 AM MDT... At 756 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an isolated thunderstorm 10 miles south of Cheyenne Wells, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall, wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Adverse travel conditions on Highway 385 between mile markers 136 and 145 in southern Cheyenne County. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado. This includes PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall with this storm may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. && MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
